description: Indicates the current state of this node.
interpretation: Values: Up (100), Down (70), Paused (50), Joining (30), Unknown (10).
troubleshootingSteps: If status is 'Down', investigate Event ID 1135 in the System log to see if the node was removed due to missed heartbeats (network issue) or if the Cluster Service crashed.[web:332][web:464][web:471]
Ensure the node can communicate with other nodes on UDP/TCP port 3343 and that no firewall rules or antivirus software are blocking cluster traffic.[web:464][web:466][web:470]
If status is 'Paused', the node was likely paused for maintenance; right-click the node in Failover Cluster Manager and select 'Resume', or use `Resume-ClusterNode` in PowerShell.[web:462]

If status is 'Joining' or stuck in that state, check for Quorum issues (e.g., witness inaccessible) or restart the Cluster Service on that node (`Stop-Service ClusSvc`, then `Start-Service ClusSvc`).[web:465][web:467][web:470]

If a node is in 'Quarantine' (a special state often reported as Down or Paused in older tools), use `Start-ClusterNode -ClearQuarantine` to force it back online after resolving the underlying stability issue.[web:469]
